intro: Hieracium simulans, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, surrounded by pale green bracts. It has a taproot system and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium simulans is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields.
